name: HDFCRAFT
body:
### Welcome to HDFCRAFT GitHub Pages.

 Minecraft is a popular game among K-12 students. Minecraft allows players to manipuate textured cubes in a 3D generated world. This project demonstrates how to use NASA Earth science data in HDF to create a Minecraft world. The goal is to give students an early exposure to NASA Earth data and let them explore a world observed by NASA satellites with Minecraft.

### Requirements

* JDK 1.7 or above
* IntelliJ
* Minecraft for PC or Mac
** Demo version is OK but full version is recommended because Creative Mode allows you to view the map globally.
* HDFView

### HDF

  HDF is a binary file format for storing scientific data. Many NASA Earth data are distributed in this format. An HDF file contains one or more datasets in different shape: 360x180, 15x1440x720, 721 x 721, etc. Therefore, it is important to understand the characteristics of datasets by reading the data product document from NASA and examining the HDF file content with HDFView.

### Building Minecraft Map

  Once you decided which dataset in HDF to use, you can create a map with either HDFCRAFT desktop or server. The desktop version is based on WorldPainter. The server version is based on Glowstone. The desktop is easy to build a map but it is only good for 2D dataset due to the 2.5D nature of WorldPainter. The server version is difficult to build a map but provides the full 3D flexibility.

### Authors and Contributors
@hyoklee modified sources from [WorldPainter](http://www.worldpainter.net/) and [Glowstone](http://www.glowstone.net).

### Support

Please issue a GitHub ticket.
